Consts.useLimit: Tool must be run using a database connection file owned by LRS user, which has data ownership priviliges necessary to disable and reenable editor tracking. An error will occur if tool is run using a database connection file not owned by the LRS user.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool inspects all feature classes in the RIS_LRS SDE geodatabase for missing DisplayIDs. If a missing DisplayID is found, the tool uses regular expressions to parse the RouteID components, so that it can be rebuilt in the DisplayID syntax. Example: US64P becomes US-64-P; USX84P168.0T becomes USX-84-P-168.0-T

tool.name: RouteConverter

param.name: DB_connection_file
param.dialogReference: Database connection file (ends with .sde) that has been created by the LRS user.
param.pythonReference: This is used to setup the geoprocessing environment for the script. Using a DB connection file not created by the LRS user results in an error due to lack of Microsoft SQL database permissions.

param.name: output_location
param.displayname: Choose Output Location for Summary Text file
param.dialogReference: The tool creates a text file titled, "RouteConverter_Log_[date]_[time]". By default, this is saved to the user's desktop.

tool.summary: This tool inspects all feature classes in the RIS_LRS SDE geodatabase for missing DisplayIDs. If a missing DisplayID is found, the tool uses regular expressions to parse the RouteID components, so that it can be rebuilt in the DisplayID syntax. Example: US64P becomes US-64-P; USX84P168.0T becomes USX-84-P-168.0-T
